name: E. Maxim and Matrix
statement:
Maxim loves to fill in a matrix in a special manner. Here is a
pseudocode of filling in a matrix of size :Maxim asks you to count, how
many numbers are there, such that the sum of values in the cells in the
row number of the resulting matrix equals .Expression ( ) means applying
the operation of bitwise excluding "OR" to numbers and . The given
operation exists in all modern programming languages. For example, in
languages and it is represented by character "", in by "".
editorial: For fixed m, the sum in the last row will be 2^(bit_count(m+1)-1). So now if T is not power of 2, answer is 0. Else we can find number of bits that we need. And know we have stndart problem. How many numbers form 2 to n+1 have exactly P bits in binary presentation of the number. It is well known problem can be done using binomial cooficients. We will count number of numebers smaller then out number with fixed prefix.
